required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Neu-Prem Trial: Neuromonitoring of Preterm Newborn Brain During Birth Resuscitation
clinical_study.official_title: The Neu-Prem Trial: Neuromonitoring of Preterm Newborn Brain During Birth Resuscitation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to characterize the normal brain function of premature infants (23 to 31+6 weeks GA) during birth transition and through the first 72 hours of life.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators will measure components of brain function using two sophisticated, non-invasive technologies. First, amplitude integrated electroencephalography (EEG), a "simplified" EEG with four sensors (single channel), enables continuous non-invasive monitoring of cerebral activity. Second, near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRS) is another non-invasive technology that allows continuous real-time measurement of regional tissue oxygen utilization of the brain. Both technologies have been used in newborns and have been predictive of brain injury or neurodevelopmental impairment.

primary_outcome.description: amplitude integrated EEG to measure brain activity
Cerebral tissue oxygen saturation (StO2), Near-infrared spectroscopy to measure brain perfusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1, 5 and 10 minutes of life if applicable

secondary_outcome.description: Arterial or venous pH (acid/base), base deficit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 10 minutes of life
secondary_outcome.description: Fraction of inspired oxygen (FiO2), cpap, positive pressure ventilation (PPV), intubations.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 10 minutes of life
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum FiO2 during resuscitation at birth

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From birth to 10 minutes of life
secondary_outcome.description: Peak inspiratory pressure of respiratory support

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate by EKG during resuscitation (substudy)
secondary_outcome.description: A substudy of 40 infants will have EKG leads placed on newborns during resuscitation; 20 will have the display blinded, and 20 will have values available to the team. The amount of resuscitation (mean airway pressure FiO2 will be compared between groups).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) admission through 72 hours of life
From NICU admission through 72 hours of life
From birth through discharge to home, up to 9 months of age
Within 24 hours of life and at approximately 72 hours of life
From birth through discharge to home, up to 9 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of brain injury (e.g. intraventricular hemorrhage (IVH), (PVL)

secondary_outcome.measure: Neurodevelopmental impairment at 2 year follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Neurodevelopmental assessment at 2 year corrected gestational age

study_pop.textblock: Premature infants delivered at 23 to 31 +6 weeks gestational age at Sharp MBHWN.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 23 to 31+6 weeks gestational age at birth
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known congenital anomalies
- Parents refuse consent
- Neonatologist declined due to subject instability

facility.name: Sharp Mary Birch Hospital for Women and Newborns
